text: Cities are home to around 75% of the EUâ€™s population and responsible for a large part of its energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions. Producing more than 70% of global CO2 emissions, cities play a pivotal role in achieving climate neutrality by 2050. More than 200 [European cities](https://eurocities.eu/projects/mayors-alliance-for-the-european-green-deal/) already lead by example with emission reduction plans that are more ambitious than their national governments. They are adapting policies, infrastructure, and making investments to become carbon negative rather than carbon neutral. A selection of 100 out of 377 EU cities who expressed an interest, are taking actions to become climate neutral and smart cities by 2030 in the framework of the [EU Cities Mission](https://research-and-innovation.ec.europa.eu/funding/funding-opportunities/funding-programmes-and-open-calls/horizon-europe/eu-missions-horizon-europe/climate-neutral-and-smart-cities_en).

Earth Observation can help to future-proof our cities by providing timely and actionable information to aid urban decision makers.

EO can for example help informing urban decision makers on the exploitation potential of urban rooftops.

High resolution Earth Observation data can support the identification of suitable locations for green or solar roofs. It can also help identify current utilization of those suitable roofs, i.e. by mapping existing green roofs or photovoltaic Systems.

EO can also support the characterization of solar irradiation that can provide insight into PV electric energy production potential.
Land surface temperatures can directly be measured by different satellites and aid in the identification of regional planning measures mitigating heat in the urban core.
Susanne Formanek, Director of GRUENSTATTGRAU GmbH explains how green roofs can make cities more liveable for current and future generations.
Our team developed a green roof impact score, indicating the impact of retrofitting a house with a green roof based on surrounding greenness and Land surface temperatures retrieved by Sentinel-3.
